resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907
 
 
   These platforms don't support `-march=armv8-a+crc+crypto` so don't think this makes sense to have as a default.
   
   Since ORC has released since a build flag was added to turn off `-Werror` I've upgraded it here and removed the previous warning workarounds
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

cyb70289 commented on pull request #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#discussion_r407367967
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/DefineOptions.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -108,7 +108,10 @@ if("${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}" STREQUAL "${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}")
 
   # Arm64 architectures and extensions can lead to exploding combinations.
   # So set it directly through cmake command line.
-  define_option_string(ARROW_ARMV8_ARCH "Arm64 arch and extensions" "armv8-a+crc+crypto")
+  define_option_string(ARROW_ARMV8_ARCH
+                       "Arm64 arch and extensions"
+                       "" # default to None
 
 Review comment:
   We can change the default value to "armv8-a"
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

cyb70289 commented on pull request #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#discussion_r407368171
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -46,7 +46,7 @@ elseif(ARROW_CPU_FLAG STREQUAL "ppc")
   # power compiler flags, gcc/clang only
   set(ARROW_ALTIVEC_FLAG "-maltivec")
   check_cxx_compiler_flag(${ARROW_ALTIVEC_FLAG} CXX_SUPPORTS_ALTIVEC)
-elseif(ARROW_CPU_FLAG STREQUAL "arm")
+elseif(ARROW_CPU_FLAG STREQUAL "arm" AND NOT ("${ARROW_ARMV8_ARCH}" STREQUAL ""))
 
 Review comment:
   then this change is not necessary
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#discussion_r407368352
 
 

 ##########

 ##########
 @@ -327,7 +328,7 @@ if(ARROW_CPU_FLAG STREQUAL "ppc" AND ARROW_USE_SIMD)
   endif()
 endif()
 
-if(ARROW_CPU_FLAG STREQUAL "arm")

 Review comment:

cyb70289 commented on issue #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#issuecomment-612804553
 
 
   > These platforms don't support `-march=armv8-a+crc+crypto` so don't think this makes sense to have as a default.
   
   Maybe pass `-DARROW_ARMV8_ARCH=armv8-a` when building these platforms and leave the default as is?
   True Arm64 servers do support these extensions.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

cyb70289 commented on issue #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#issuecomment-612804553
 
 
   > These platforms don't support `-march=armv8-a+crc+crypto` so don't think this makes sense to have as a default.
   
   Maybe pass `-DARROW_ARMV8_ARCH=armv8-a` when building these platforms and leave the default as is?
   True Arm64 servers(I mean servers deployed seriously in data center) do support these extensions.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#issuecomment-612896453
 
 
   > Maybe pass -DARROW_ARMV8_ARCH=armv8-a when building these platforms and leave the default as is?
   
   Having the default build fail on some ARMv8 platforms (on "unserious" ones, I guess =) ) doesn't seem right to me. I would push back against having `-march=avx2` as the default for x64 builds for the same reason. These options are primarily intended for people building packages or developers optimizing for certain CPU capabilities
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on issue #6907: ARROW-8410: [C++] Fix compilation errors on modest ARMv8 platforms (rockpro64, rpi4)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6907#issuecomment-612940401
 
 
   @wesm can you test this with docker?
   
   ```
   ARCH=arm64v8 docker-compose build ubuntu-cpp
   ARCH=arm64v8 docker-compose run --rm ubuntu-cpp
   ```
   
   probably need to add to the volumes section of docker-compose.yml
   
   ```yaml
     arm64v8-conda-cache:
     arm64v8-cuda-9.1-cache:
     arm64v8-cuda-10.0-cache:
     arm64v8-cuda-10.1-cache:
     arm64v8-debian-9-cache:
     arm64v8-debian-10-cache:
     arm64v8-fedora-30-cache:
     arm64v8-ubuntu-14.04-cache:
     arm64v8-ubuntu-16.04-cache:
     arm64v8-ubuntu-18.04-cache:
     arm64v8-ubuntu-20.04-cache:
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I was trying to build the project on a rockpro64 system to look into something else and ran into this

{code}
-- Arrow build warning level: PRODUCTION
CMake Error at cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake:332 (message):
  Unsupported arch flag: -march=armv8-a+crc+crypto.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:398 (include)

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
{code}
fields.summary: [C++] CMake fails on aarch64 systems that do not support -march=armv8-a+crc+crypto
